snippet: New Jersey and New York both said they would allow voters uprooted by Hurricane Sandy to cast provisional ballots anywhere in their states.
abstract: Elected officials in New York and New Jersey rush to find ways to enable residents displaced by Hurricane Sandy to vote in election; say they will allow displaced voters to cast provisional ballots anywhere in their states; ballots may, in some cases, only allow residents to vote in statewide and presidential election, not in local and Congressional races.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER, THOMAS KAPLAN and WENDY RUDERMAN

lead_paragraph: New Jersey and New York both said they would allow voters uprooted by Hurricane Sandy to cast provisional ballots anywhere in their states.

headline.seo: Amid Cleanup and Recovery, Scramble to Help the Displaced Cast Ballots
headline.main: Officials Rush to Find Ways for the Storm-Tossed to Vote
headline.print_headline: Officials Rush to Find Ways For the Storm-Tossed to Vote
